title.narrative: Great Voices for Women Leadership Campai

description.narrative:
Great Voices for Women Campaign by GOTNI is an advocacy campaign for women in political leadership in Nigeria, to stop the marginalization of women from seeking political office positions and participating actively in its processes. The project will achieve Attitudinal Change, sensitization and reorientation of Nigerians (both male and female) on the importance of women participation in governance.
Part of this project will focus on identifying and interviewing 15 Role models within Nigeria, Africa and the World. The aimof the program is to air the endorsement of these great figures, encouraging and reaffirming Women Participation in Governance in Nigeria. As elections are fast approaching, it is important to build a critical mass of Nigerians to support the emergence of qualitywomen in governance. At the end of this campaign, it is expected that several women with the desire to serve Nigeria in different capacities would have made up their minds to seek the opportunity to be elected or appointed into public positions. Great Voices for Women Campaign would comprise of Interview sessions with individuals of relevance in the society who occupy both public and private offices, who would inspire Nigerian citizens to support women participation in governance. Great Voices for Women appeals to Young adults, Parents, Grass-root Population, Professional bodies, Political Parties, who are hungry to see a change in the increase of female gender participation in governance Invited guests would be allocateddeliberate, crafted words to motivate and inspire the femalegender to participate in political activities and governance The programme creates a change in the mind of both the male and femalegender on the importance of women participation in politics and governance. The programme is designed to meet the demands of women for adequate representation in leadership and governance positions. Great Voices for Women is highly appropriate at this time, especially with the 2015 elections fast approaching. Expected changes include 1. Change in the attitude of political parties with respectto increase in women participation in politics and governance 2. More women participating in electioneering and governance processes 3. More men allowing their wives torun for political office

participating-org.narrative: GOTNI was founded in the year 1996. The vision was birthed by its President, Linus Okorie, as an undergraduate in the Imo State University. It began with a desire to see the right set of leaders elected into student government leadership positions in theUniversity, eventually permeating to witnessing the election of credible leaders in political leadership positions across Nigeria as a whole.GOTNI as an organization has experienced tremendous growth since its inception, moving from a university based vision, to a national vision of raising young men and women all over the nation, who will be taught the right sets of leadership values for transformational leadership in their fields of endeavour and in every aspect of the Nigerian polity. The Organizationis a registered, Non-profit, Non-Governmental organization growing from gathering a few youths for leadership empowerment programs and seminars in Lagos Nigeria, to holding larger leadership conferences, seminars and programs all across the country fromLagos to Owerri, to Abuja, to Port Harcourt and to other parts of the country. Over the years, other brands of GOTNI have emerged such as the Leadership Clinic monthly seminars, Leadership Clinic on television and radio, the Emerging Leaders Conference, theGOTNI Community Outreach Program, the GOTNI Mission to Schools Outreach among others. GOTNI has made big leaps in integrating both genders into its programmes and initiatives, with key positions and responsibilities handled by females. For example, the GOTNI radio and television shows are headed by females, the team leads for events and logistics, communication and media are females. These are the reasons why GOTNI is on an advocacy campaign for women in political leadership in Nigeria, and stop the marginalization of women from seeking political office positions andparticipating actively in its processes. In the past three years, GOTNI has been able to empower over 10,000 Young Nigerians who have participated in her programmes and Leadership conferences and seminars such as the Emerging Leaders Conference, The National Youth Economic Summit, and the Leadership Clinic and among other GOTNI programmes and initiatives. The Leadership Clinic on television has also been a tool to reach both young and old Nigerians, addressing critical leadership issues confronting our country and providing solutions, as well as teaching the right leadership values that will help them in their daily living. The GOTNI Youth EmpowermentSummits have witnessed the emergence of future leaders among the youth, equipped with the right sets of leadership values needed for the transformation of Nigeria
